definition: lit. 之[zhi1], 乎[hu1], 者[zhe3] and 也[ye3] (four grammatical particles of Classical Chinese) (idiom); fig. archaic expressions
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
surname Ye
mouth full of literary phrases/to spout the classics
pinyin: man3 kou3 zhi1 hu1 zhe3 ye3

sentences.english: A short while cured too much and gave Lan Hui after the vein it also say.
sentences.chinese: 一會太醫到了，給瀾惠把了脈後之乎者也的一頓說。

sentences.english: When he spoke to people, he was always spouting the classics.
sentences.chinese: 他對人說話，總是滿口之乎者也。

sentences.english: He used so many archaisms in his speech that half of it was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他對人說話，總是滿口之乎者也，叫人半懂不懂的。

definition: bookish/genteel/erudite
lit. to wave around one's bookbag (idiom)/fig. to show off one's erudition/a person who does so
holy book
bookish/genteel/erudite
to not fully understand (idiom)
pedant/old fogey
incoherent (writing or speech)/nonsensical/a load of crap
pedant
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
to bite words and chew characters (idiom); punctilious about minutiae of wording
Four Books, namely: the Great Learning 大學|大学, the Doctrine of the Mean 中庸, the Analects of Confucius 論語|论语, and Mencius 孟子
scholar/intellectual
to not fully understand/to only partly understand
(slang) swearword/four-letter word
Three Character Classic, 13th century reading primer consisting of Confucian tenets in lines of 3 characters
Classical Chinese writing
eight-part essay one had to master to pass the imperial exams in Ming and Qing dynasties
